page.title: 12ROADS AND WAYS
page.content: We surveyed the A616 Huddersfield to Sheffield road which follows the line of the old turnpike road.(There is still an old toll house near Victoria called Gatehead Barhouse(176058).)It is used by many vehicles, 136 an hour between 11am and noon, including 22 lorries carrying clay pipes(from Hepworth Iron Company), steel, cattle, sheep, beer, fish and yarn. There are lanes, greenways, bridlepaths and footpaths criss-crossing the main road which provide ways for local people. The many greenways, wide tracks between two walls, were once the main thoroughfares. Footpaths cross the countryside with many types of stile built into the dry stone walls. New stiles tend to be wood especially where walls have decayed. Some of the paths were paved by the mill owners and remain in part(162077)(161071).
